snippet: The automaker’s directors were caught off guard by the extent of the problems that led to the recall of millions of vehicles, but their chairman says they are now “very much involved” in the situation.
abstract: Board of directors at General Motors, under harsh criticism for lax oversight in years leading up to massive recall, have sworn to become far more involved in vehicle safety and quality control; board, which has experienced high turnover in recent years, is subject of multiple lawsuits accusing it of failing to oversee management; members say they were blindsided by corporate misconduct that set off most serious safety crisis in company's history.
lead_paragraph: The automaker’s directors were caught off guard by the extent of the problems that led to the recall of millions of vehicles, but their chairman says they are now “very much involved” in the situation.

headline.main: G.M.’s Board Is Seen as Slow in Reacting to Safety Crisis
headline.print_headline: G.M.’s Board Is Seen as Slow in Reacting to Safety Crisis
